type DirectiveCollection = class interface seq<KeyValuePair<string, seq<string>>> interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A collection of directives parsed from a command line.
Docs.remarks: A directive is specified on the command line using square brackets, containing no spaces and preceding other tokens unless they are also directives. In the following example, two directives are present, directive-one and directive-two: > myapp [directive-one] [directive-two:value] arg1 arg2 The second has a value specified as well, value. Directive values can be read by calling using .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.CommandLine.DirectiveCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface.
